CatDescriptText: Mr. Leo Bridges, oxygen therapist, Homewood and Mr. Phillip Wuerthele, Brentwood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 30, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think the United States should go to war with Russia over Berlin?"  Mr. Bridges' answer reads: "We should not go to war.  We have too much at stake.  Nuclear war would mean danger for the entire world.  We should try to negotiate and reach an agreement."  Mr. Wuerthele's answer reads: "I don't think so, because war would affect the whole world.  And the United States should take care of its own troubles here are stop butting into world problems.  We have enough problems here.  For instance, employment and integration..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Leo Bridges wearing gabardine suit jacket, standing on sidewalk in front of stores; Portrait of Phillip Wuerthele wearing striped polo shirt standing in front of store window with sign inscribed "Sweepstakes...Listen to KQV Radio"
